meanings.definition: A container holding a supply of ink or toner for a printer.
meanings.sent1: I replaced the empty cartridge in the printer with a new one.
meanings.sent2: The printer ran out of ink, so I had to buy a new cartridge.
meanings.sent3: The cartridge in the printer decided to take a vacation right before my important presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cartridge of ideas, ready to be printed onto the blank canvas of the world.
meanings.sent5: The colorful cartridge danced across the paper, leaving a trail of creativity behind.

meanings.definition: A small metal case containing a bullet or shell for a firearm.
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded the cartridge into his rifle before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The hunter always carries extra cartridges for his shotgun when out in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the cartridge for a nut and tried to bury it in the ground.
meanings.sent4: His words were like bullets, each sentence a cartridge fired with precision.
meanings.sent5: The cartridge gleamed in the sunlight, a deadly reminder of its purpose.

meanings.definition: A device containing magnetic tape or a microchip used in electronic equipment.
meanings.sent1: The technician inserted the cartridge into the computer to expand its storage capacity.
meanings.sent2: The gaming console required a special cartridge to play the new video game.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat batted at the cartridge, trying to understand its electronic secrets.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a digital cartridge, storing memories that could be replayed at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The cartridge hummed softly, transferring data with effortless precision.
